info.name: righto
info.attribution:
The implementation and assets, including the library image, were created by Mitchell Stolycia.

Everything is released to the public domain under CC0.
info.description:
- righto definition:
an informal, british exclamation used to express agreement.
- synonyms:
indeed · all right · okey dokey
- example:
"we think these cards are in the correct order."
"righto, let's flip 'em"
info.ruleText:
1. All players will be dealt a card between 1 and 100.
  2. A category is chosen between the players, for example "least to most famous celebrity, with 100 being the most famous".
  3. Write a clue on your card in line with the number on your card.
    • You cannot include numbers, values or quantities in your clue.
  4. Players then play their cards number side up in any order. There is no turn order.
    • Cards can only be played directly to the left, right or in between previously played cards, clue side up (number side down).
  5. During and after playing cards, feel free to rearrange any cards. Openly discuss where you think any cards should be, and come to a joint agreement. You can and should talk about your own cards as well as others'.
  6. Once the table has agreed, flip the cards over to their numbered side.
  7. If the cards are in ascending order, you collectively win as a table. Otherwise, play another round.
Think you know your way around righto? For a more difficult game, deal more cards to each player with the Deal an extra card button.
info.helpText:
Once all players have sat down by clicking on a seat, press New round to start a new round.

Feeling extra confident? Righto, play with extra cards in hand by clicking the Deal an extra card button.

Choosing a category:
  • Click on Click to change category and write your category.
    • Using "to" or a backslash "/" will split your category and overwrite the "0" and "101" scale.
    • Using a colon ":" to precede your scale within a category will format the scale similarly.
      • Example: "The Beatles: Worst to Best", will result in the "0" and "101" being overwritten with "0 Worst" and "101 Best" respectively.
    • The ends of the scale can also be manually changed by clicking on them.
  • Category cards are not used in this implementation. Come up with your own!
To play a card:
  1. Click Write clue card to write your answer on your cards.
  2. Drag your card to an open slot on the table.
  3. If playing with multiple cards per player, repeat steps 1 and 2 for each card.
    • Note: All cards in your hand will get written on every time Write clue card is used, so play your cards one at a time.
To rearrange cards:
Click on the appropriate ⇆ button.
